member.summary: Represents the field Zq.

member.summary: Constructs a FieldZq.

member.summary: Generates a random Zq element.
member.param: True to return a non-zero element.

member.summary: Generates an array of random Zq element.
member.param: The number of elements to return.

member.name: M:UProveCrypto.FieldZq.Negate(UProveCrypto.BigInteger)
member.summary: Returns the negation of a Zq element, i.e., the additive inverse mod q.

member.name: M:UProveCrypto.FieldZq.Inverse(UProveCrypto.BigInteger)
member.summary: Returns the multiplicative inverse of i.

members.member:
Transforms a hash digest into a Zq element. The digest is interpreted as an unsigned integer in big-endian byte order modulo q.
A digest value.. A Zq element.

member.name: M:UProveCrypto.FieldZq.CheckRange(UProveCrypto.BigInteger)
member.summary: Checks that 0 <= i < q.
member.exception: Thrown if i is not in range.

member.name: M:UProveCrypto.GroupDescription.DeriveElement(System.Byte[],System.Byte,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Derives an unpredictable element of the group, using the input. Each construction defines its own derivation mechanism, but each takes an optional context string and an index, and returns a counter. Calling this method with the same parameter values returns the same element and counter, calling it with a different context or index value must return a different element.
member.param: An optional context used by the derivation mechanism, can be null.
A counter value indicating the state at which the derivation mechanism stopped.

member.name: T:UProveCrypto.Prover
member.summary: Implements the Prover side of the U-Prove issuance protocol. One instance must be created for each run of the issuance protocol, in which many U-Prove tokens can be obtained in parallel.

member.name: M:UProveCrypto.Prover.#ctor(UProveCrypto.IssuerParameters,System.Int32,System.Byte[][],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],UProveCrypto.IDevice)
member.summary: Constructs a new Prover instance.
member.param: The Device. If this parameter is non-null, then the issued tokens will be Device-protected.

member.name: M:UProveCrypto.Prover.#ctor(UProveCrypto.IssuerParameters,System.Int32,System.Byte[][],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],UProveCrypto.IDevice,UProveCrypto.ProverRandomData)
member.summary: Constructs a new Prover instance.

member.summary: Generates the second issuance message.

member.name: M:UProveCrypto.Prover.GenerateTokens(UProveCrypto.ThirdIssuanceMessage,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Generates the U-Prove key and tokens.
member.param: Set to true to skip token validation; false otherwise. Token validation SHOULD be performed before use, either by setting skipTokenValidation to false, or by later using the ProtocolHelper.VerifyTokenSignature method.
member.exception: If the token signature is invalid.
member.returns: An array of U-Prove keys and tokens

member.name: T:UProveCrypto.GroupDescriptionSerializable
member.summary: This class is a serializable version of GroupDescription used only during serialization. Serializing GroupDescription will result in the creation and serialization of this class instead. This class is also created upon deserialization. The ToGroupDescription() method will be called by the surrogate class to create a new GroupDescription from this class.

member.name: T:UProveCrypto.SubgroupGroupDescriptionSerializable
member.summary: This class is a serializable version of SubgroupGroupDescription used only during serialization. Serializing SubgroupGroupDescription will result in the creation and serialization of this class instead. This class is also created upon deserialization. The ToSubgroupGroupDescription() method will be called by the surrogate class to create a new SubgroupGroupDescription from this class.

member.name: T:UProveCrypto.PresentationProof
member.summary: Represents a presentation proof.

member.name: M:UProveCrypto.PresentationProof.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new PresentationProof instance.

member.name: M:UProveCrypto.PresentationProof.#ctor(System.Byte[][],System.Byte[],System.Byte[],UProveCrypto.GroupElement,UProveCrypto.BigInteger[],UProveCrypto.CommitmentValues[])
member.summary: Constructs a new PresentationProof instance.
Generates a presentation proof including optionally presenting a pseudonym, creating attribute commitments, and passing pre-generated random values.
member.param: The issuer parameters corresponding to upkt.
An ordered array of disclosed attribute indices.
An ordered array of committed attribute indices.
Index of the attribute used to create a scope-exclusive pseudonym, or 0 if no pseudonym is to be presented. The index must not be part of the disclosed attributes.
The pseudonym scope, or null if no pseudonym is to be presented.
The message for the Device, or null.
The active device context, if token is device-protected, or null.
Optional pregenerated random data for the proof generation.
Returned tildeO values if commitments are computed.

member.summary: Generates a presentation proof including optionally presenting a pseudonym, and creating attribute commitments.
member.param: The issuer parameters corresponding to upkt.
An ordered array of disclosed attribute indices.
An ordered array of committed attribute indices.
Index of the attribute used to create a scope-exclusive pseudonym, or 0 if no pseudonym is to be presented. The index must not be part of the disclosed attributes.
The pseudonym scope, or null if no pseudonym is to be presented.
The message for the Device, or null.
The active device context, if token is device-protected, or null.
Returned tildeO values if commitments are computed.

member.summary: Verifies a presentation proof.

An ordered array of disclosed attribute indices.
The message for the Device, or null.
member.exception: Thrown if the proof is invalid.

member.summary: Verifies a presentation proof with a presented pseudonym and committed values.
member.param: The issuer parameters associated with upt.
An ordered array of disclosed attribute indices.
An ordered array of committed attribute indices.
Index of the attribute used to create a scope-exclusive pseudonym, or 0 if no pseudonym is to be presented. The index must not be part of the disclosed attributes.
The pseudonym scope, or null if no pseudonym is to be presented.
The message for the Device, or null.
member.exception: Thrown if the proof is invalid.
